metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3597 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple buffer overflows in the php_parserr function in ext/standard/dns.c in PHP before 5.4.32 and 5.5.x before 5.5.16 allow remote DNS servers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted DNS record, related to the dns_get_record function and the dn_expand function.  NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-4049.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3597` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-gmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4

php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4

php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4').
